fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27513]. {panel} Importing XML site backup from a PostgreSQL-based Confluence to a MySQL-based Confluence fails due to size limit for DESCRIPTION column in AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION table (maximum size limit is 65535). The Notification table in Confluence contains a JIRA comment notification that exceeds the maximum size limit, which only occurs when users receive a notification on the comments on watched JIRA issues. *Steps to reproduce* # Set up JIRA 5.2 or above with Demo project and issues created # Set up Confluence behind PostgreSQL database # Ensure that the Application Links between JIRA and Confluence are established # Follow [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Workbox+Notifications] to configure Workbox Notifications. The following needs to be configured: #* In-App Applications #* Including notifications from JIRA # Create two users both in Confluence and JIRA (e.g. {{admin}} and {{test}}) # Login as {{admin}}, go to an issue in JIRA and watch the issue # Login as {{test}}: ## Go to the same issue in JIRA watched by {{admin}} ## Copy the whole content of [^99999characters.txt] file ## Paste this into a comment of the issue page # Ensure that the {{admin}} user receive the notification # Create a site XML backup for Confluence and then stop this instance # Set up a new Confluence instance behind *MySQL database* # Restore the XML backup The restore does not complete with the following error: !screenshot.jpg|width=500! The following appears in the log: {noformat}2012-12-11 20:13:15,751 ERROR [Long running task: Importing data] [confluence.importexport.actions.ImportLongRunningTask] runInternal Failure during import -- referer: http://localhost:8050/conf/setup/setup-restore-start.action | url: /conf/setup/setup-restore.action | userName: anonymous | action: setup-restore com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with plugin Notifications and Tasks - Host Plugin(com.atlassian.mywork.mywork-confluence-host-plugin) #1.1.2: Could not import data in table 'AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION' column #6, value is too big for column which size limit is 65535, value is:

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Aenean commodo ligula eget dolor. Aenean massa. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus. Donec quam felis, ultricies nec, pellentesque eu, pretium quis, sem. Nulla consequat massa quis enim. Donec pede justo, fringilla vel, aliquet nec, vulputate eget, arcu. In enim justo, rhoncus ut, imperdiet a, venenatis vitae, justo. Nullam dictum felis eu pede mollis pretium. Integer tincidunt. Cras dapibus. Vivamus elementum semper nisi. Aenean vulputate eleifend tellus. Aenean leo ligula, porttitor eu, consequat vitae, eleifend ac, enim. Aliquam lorem ante, dapibus in, viverra quis, feugiat a, tellus. Phasellus viverra nulla ut metus varius laoreet. Quisque rutrum. Aenean imperdiet. Etiam ultricies nisi vel augue. Curabitur ullamcorper ultricies nisi. Nam eget dui. Etiam rhoncus. Maecenas tempus, tellus eget condimentum rhoncus, sem quam semper libero, sit amet adipiscing sem neque sed ipsum. Nam quam nunc, blandit vel, luctus pulvinar, hendrerit id, lorem. Maecenas nec odio et ante tincidunt tempus. Donec vitae sapien ut libero .........{noformat} *Workaround* # Backup the Confluence database (PostgreSQL) of the original instance # Identify the notifications that exceed the size limit in the Confluence database (PostgreSQL): {code:sql}select char_length ("DESCRIPTION"), "ID" from "AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION" where char_length ("DESCRIPTION") > 65535 order by 1 DESC;{code} # You can then run the SQL to update/clear these notifications: {code:sql}UPDATE "AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION" SET "DESCRIPTION" ='NULL' WHERE "ID" IN (select "ID" from "AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION" where char_length ("DESCRIPTION") > 65535);{code} # Export the XML site # Import it into MySQL-based Confluence instance h4. Possible cause The max length data types for "String (clob)" as per [this table|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/AO/AO+0.18.x+Upgrade+Guide#AO0.18.xUpgradeGuide-TypeChanges] don't hold the *same max length* across all the database types. In this case, for example: - MySQL's TEXT can hold up to 65535 characters/bytes ([reference|http://www.electrictoolbox.com/maximum-length-mysql-text-field-types/]) - PostgreSQL's TEXT can hold up to 1GB ([reference|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10395975/maximum-size-of-text-datatype-in-postgresql]), that is 1073741824 bytes/characters That explains, why TEXT-data-type columns in Postgres DB can hold bigger values which causes the data can't be imported to TEXT-data-type columns in MySQL. Perhaps we need to use different datatype in MySQL columns that could hold data up to 1GB, e.g. LONGTEXT?
fields.summary: Importing XML site backup fails due to size limit for DESCRIPTION column in AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION table

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a Global Template which contains Metadata Details macro with variable e.g
!template.png!
# Save the template and create a new page with this template
# You will not be able to use the template and the error will appear:
!error.png!

Additionally, you can't insert Wiki Markup in a template and you'll get this Bad Request:
!bad_request.png!



This used to work in Confluence 3.5 and below.
fields.summary: Template that contains Metadata Details macro with variable will not work using the new editor
Do autosuggest a label which has already been added
Autosuggest labels shorted by popularity

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27506].
  {panel}

Plain text searching for jira issues does not work

*Steps to reproduce*
# Install Confluence 5.0 OD 19
# Add 'http://jira.atlassian.com' as an application link (or any jira instance)
# Create a new page in Confluence, edit it and select 'insert'->'jira issue'
# Select 'search' in the issue browser wizard and enter any plain text for searching
# Receive the error 'recieved the following http error code from the server:0' (see attached 'jira issue error.jpg' for a screen shot)

*Workaround*
Use JQL to look for issues
fields.summary: Jira issue 'search' function fails

fields.description:
For some reason, when using the multimedia macro with SWF files that have 'attachment' word in the name, the macro simply don't render in the page.

h2. Steps to reproduce

1) Download the attached swf files

2) Attach them to a page

3) Insert a multimedia macro and save the page with those two files.

The macro won't render for files with the 'attachment' word in the name.
fields.summary: Multimedia macro doesn't work with SWF files that have 'attachment' word in the name
Workbox notifications are not sorted by created date when using MySQL
Provide the ability to search for external link URLs

fields.description:
We use the attachment macro to list various photoshop files.

If you want to download the file and click on the link it looks like confluence want to open it in the image box (fancy box) and then the whole browser freezes. If you use right mouse click and save as, then it works. If you use the attachment view, then it also works.

On 4.3.5, clicking the file in the Attachments macro freezes for some time, then displays the attached screenshot. Confluence does not know how to interpret this type of file.

h3. Workaround
Enter a link to the attachment instead, by going to Insert > Attachment. This will download the item when clicked.
fields.summary: Click psd-file link in the attachment macro causes browser freeze
Ability to find pages with no content
Improve performance using IE

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create list item
# @mention a user
# Insert blank space followed by some text, directly after the mention
# Press Enter and Tab to insert an indented list item
# Enter some additional text on the indented line so it looks like this:
#- [~ttheb] some text
#-- some more text
# Save the page
# *Expected result* - there is a space between the mention and the text
# *Actual result* - the space is stripped - it is there in edit-mode, but is then missing in view-mode.

h3. Workaround
Edit the page and enter the space again. This time when you save it the space will remain.
fields.summary: Missing blank when using @mention inside a list-item, with an indented list item following

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27498].
  {panel}

In the Space administration should be an option to set a default restriction for new pages.
e.g.:
Viewing restricted to: group "internal users"
Editing restricted to: group "internal users"

If a user adds an new page, this page should be restricted like configured (+ a view and edit permission for the creator).
This feature ensures that an article can't be viewed by everyone, unless it has been reviewed and approved for all space users.
fields.summary: Set default page restriction when adding a page

fields.description:

Result: Cells do not pick up the right fill style
Expected: That it would work
fields.summary: Excel viewer does not render cells whose fill value comes from a cell style correctly
Add more colors to table cell highlighting
On the tools menu switching between item status removes the highlight…

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
Issue is described in this KB - https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/lySvEg

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Disable jira-connector (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.jira.jira-connector) plugin
# Create/edit a page. Wait for the regular intervals, the automatic draft saving is not working at all. 

h4. Findings
Monitorin the http activity through Chrome's developer tools or Firefox's firebug network panel, after certain intervals, the following requests are triggered:
||URL||HTTP Request Method ||Triggered? ||
|http://Confluence-URL/rest/tinymce/1/drafts |POST|(x)|
|http://Confluence-URL/json/startheartbeatactivity.action |POST|(/)|
|http://Confluence-URL/rest/mywork/latest/status/notification/count |GET|(/)|

h4. Expected behavior
Since the plugin seems to have nothing to do with Draft Saving, the draft should remains working as is.

h4. Workaround
Follow the steps in the KB - https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/lySvEg
fields.summary: Automatic draft saving stops working when jira-connector com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.jira.jira-connector plugin is disabled
"Use the User's Membership Attribute" checkboxes modify the wrong attribute in the database.
Separate Global Template permissions from Confluence Admin rights

fields.description:
If you add the livesearch macro in a page and enter the text "abc" you get redirected to a search page for the expression "abc* OR abc". This behaviour does not match the one in any other search box.

Also by searching in the macro the string "abc*", it becomes the expression "abc** OR abc*".

Shouldn't the livesearch macro behave as any other search box?
fields.summary: Livesearch of term in page added JQuery expresion

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Attach a PDF file (example) to a page in Confluence
# Edit the page and add a PDF macro (viewpdf) to the page
# Add an image to the page, directly below the PDF macro
# Save the page, then try to enlarge the image by clicking on it in IE

You will see this:
!enlarge.jpg!

Notice that the PDF macro overlaps the enlarged image? 

Although the viewPDF macro will always be highlighted when the image is enlarged, even in Firefox, at least in Firefox it does not overlap on top of the enlarged image.
fields.summary: Flash (such as viewfile macro) will always be displayed on top of other content in IE

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Attach an image file with a very long filename to a page in Confluence
# Edit the page, and hit '!' (the image macro), which will then popup the file suggestions. Hover over the image file with the long filename, and notice that the tooltip shows the exact same filename (abbreviated):
!tooltip.jpg!

This defeats the purpose of the tooltip.
fields.summary: Tooltip for File Suggestions Does Not Show the Full Filename But the Same Abbreviated Name

fields.description:
Multimedia macro does not allow embedding files that are attached to another page. The dialog says:
!anypage.png!

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a page, attach a video file of your choice
# Create another page and try to insert a multimedia macro
# The previously attached file from the other page is not displayed

*Workaround*
Start typing {{!}} and the first characters of the name of the file and you can embed the video this way.
fields.summary: Cannot embed multimedia attached to another page

fields.description:
When using the *Recently Updated Dashboard* macro on a page and having the *Show User Profile Pictures* option enabled adds extra line breaks after icons (see screenshot below).

!recently1.png!



*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a page
# Add the *Recently Updated Dashboard* macro (note that it is not the *Recently Updated* macro)
# Edit macro settings and select the tickbox *Show User Profile Pictures*

*Workaround*
Use the *Recently Updated* macro instead.

It appears that the macro is only problematic when not used on the dashboard, but any other page instead.
fields.summary: Recently updated dashboard macro extra line breaks
Make j/k shortcuts discoverable in workbox

fields.description:
We have several sites and content written in german.

But when we use the following search syntax, problems occur:

Searching for Simulator:

Simu* -> doesn't find results
simu* -> finds all results

That is reproducable with any word and a major problem for us, because the users cannot find anything.

Can anbody confirm?
fields.summary: Searching in Confluence not working with wildcards and case sensivity
Ensure viewfile macro doesn't break if attachment is moved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27476].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Go to page 
# Click on Edit 
# Click on Insert-> Gliffy Diagram
# Create the diagram and then save it
# Click on Insert-> Gliffy Diagram once again
# Click on Search
# Enter the name of the image you've created previously, select All Spaces in dropdown and enter
# Nothing shows up on the search results
fields.summary: Search option form the Insert Gilffy diagram not working
Add Ability to Configure Timeout on html-include Macro

fields.description:
The office connector doesn't display the SmartArt inside a xlsx file when using the Office macro in a confluence page.

h2. Steps to reproduce
1- Use the attached file to this bug.
2- Create a page and attach the xlsx to it
3- Create a office macro and point to the xlsx file
4- Save the page
fields.summary: Office Connector Excel SmartArt Not Displaying
Comment in old attachments versions

fields.description:
h3.Problem
When clicking "Cancel" in Confluence Editor to discard any changes to a page, the following appears in the atlassian-confluence.log:
{code}
2012-10-22 22:21:23,956 ERROR [http-8043-6] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- url: /pages/doeditpage.action | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8043/pages/editpage.action?pageId=4064
java.lang.NumberFormatException: null
    at java.lang.Long.parseLong(Long.java:375)
    at java.lang.Long.parseLong(Long.java:468)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Draft.getPageIdAsLong(Draft.java:83)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.AbstractCreateAndEditPageAction.getCancelResult(AbstractCreateAndEditPageAction.java:630)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.AbstractEditPageAction.getCancelResult(AbstractEditPageAction.java:296)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.core.CancellingInterceptor.intercept(CancellingInterceptor.java:20)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.xwork.HttpMethodValidationInterceptor.intercept(HttpMethodValidationInterceptor.java:72)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.security.websudo.WebSudoInterceptor.intercept(WebSudoInterceptor.java:63)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.themes.ThemeContextInterceptor.intercept(ThemeContextInterceptor.java:68)
.....{code}

h3.Cause

Confluence is not able to convert the Draft Page ID due to invalid format.
h3.Workaround
For a known workaround please refer to [NumberFormatException When Cancelling Page Edits|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/NumberFormatException+When+Cancelling+Page+Edits]
fields.summary: NumberFormatException When Cancelling Page Edits

* Manually delete these notifications

fields.description:
User has an attachment link that he updates regularly. This is how he works:

1. Click on "Edit" to edit the page
2. Click on the attachment link and select "Edit" button
3. Uploaded the new attachment file 
4. Select the new uploaded file. Remain the existing link text and click "OK"

However, this is where it goes wrong. Instead of just updating the existing link text with new uploaded file, it creates a new link text which jumble up with the existing one. So, the link text has both "old link text" with "old attachment" and "new link text" with "new attachment". Please find attachment where I shall explain better.

It is very troublesome to just update the existing link with the new document. Do you have any permanent solution to this issue? Please advice. 

h3. Workaround
Remove the existing link, then click Insert - Attachment to upload and insert the new attachment.
fields.summary: Attachment link failed to update correctly in IE8

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27460].
  {panel}

In the [Configuring Workbox Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF43/Configuring+Workbox+Notifications] page, it reads:

{quote}
To include notifications from JIRA:

# Connect JIRA and Confluence via application links: (Not applicable to Confluence OnDemand.)
* Choose Browse > Confluence Admin.
* Choose Application Links in the left-hand panel.
* Set up the link as described in Adding an Application Link.
* If your JIRA server is linked to more than one Confluence server, make sure that the primary link is the Confluence server that will display the in-app notifications in its workbox. See the JIRA guide to making an application link the primary link.
# Choose In-app Notifications in the left-hand panel of the Confluence administration console.
# Choose displays in-app notifications from other servers.
* Your JIRA server will appear in the list of linked applications below this option.
* People will see JIRA notifications in their workbox, as described in Managing Notifications in Confluence.
{quote}

Perhaps we should include that you need to set up the link so that the two applications _fully trust each other_ for the Workbox notifications to work.

If I am not missing something, should we perhaps edit our documentation to mention that?
fields.summary: JIRA should be a Trusted Application in order for JIRA notifications to show up in Confluence Workbox

fields.description:
Hi,

I have attached a simple plugin (+source) which outlines this problem better than I can explain it.

Essentially, if one updates a text property through the content property manager to a new key with the same name, but different capitalisation (such as "First" to "first"), the new key is *sometimes* not written to the database, and is held in the cache.  Additionally, this is then not deleted from the cache through a removeProperties call.

Things to note:
* This *only* fails in MySQL (5.5 tested) - PostgreSQL and the HSQLDB do not experience this problem
* This has come via one of our customers, and has the potential to affect many heavy users of the Metadata plugin

If you've got any questions, please comment.

Kind regards,

Jamie Sawyer
Consultant, Adaptavist.com Ltd.
fields.summary: Confluence ContentPropertyManager.setTextProperty fails to write to MySQL DB with capitalisation

fields.description:
Due to infrastructural changes made in Confluence 4.2, the standard Confluence footer is now only displayed by default when a built-in standard theme in Confluence is active.

This causes confusion for plugin and theme developers - it is not obvious why the footer disappears when a custom theme is installed. Additionally, there is no easy way to turn the default footer back on for a custom theme - the theme must either override the main decorator (a brittle extension point) or duplicate the footer web panel in the plugin.

The default behaviour for a custom theme module should be to display the default footer.

h2. Workaround

Until this bug is fixed, the easiest way to display the standard footer in your custom theme is to duplicate the footer's "Web Panel" module in your theme plugin. In order to do this, you just need to add the following snippet to your {{atlassian-plugin.xml}} file. Make sure to customise the "condition" element to suit your needs.

{code:lang=xml}
<web-panel key="confluence-footer-workaround" name="Confluence Footer Workaround" location="atl.footer">
    <description>Displays the Confluence standalone footer when the custom theme is enabled</description>
    
    <!-- We only want to render this web panel when our custom theme is activated. Otherwise, if a built-in theme is activated, the footer will appear twice! -->
    <condition class="com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.web.conditions.ActiveThemeCondition">
        <!-- Set the 'value' to be the fully-qualified plugin module key of your theme module. For example, if your plugin key is "com.example.confluence.test-plugin" and the <theme> module has a key of "my-theme", then you should set the value here to be "com.example.confluence.test-plugin:my-theme".-->
        <param name="themes" value="my.confluence.plugin:theme-key"/>
    </condition>

    <!-- this is the velocity template built in to Confluence that displays the standard footer -->
    <resource name="view" type="confluence-velocity" location="/decorators/includes/footer.vm">
        <param name="source" value="webConextStatic"/>
    </resource>
</web-panel>
{code}
fields.summary: The standard Confluence footer is not displayed when developing a new custom theme

But, if you install the demo .jar it doesn't work (page border and footer are lost).

Problem 2: if we really really have to go down the build-using-SDK route we need documentation that works.
I have listed the troubles in CSP-92092, but the current blocker is that the "atlas-mvn eclipse:eclipse" command fails (see the CSP for errors) with missing files.
Your support desk tells me I need to install these, but I need instructions on how to do so.

Fundamentally someone should write/correct/test your documentation and/or SDK packaging to something that works.

fields.description:
We upgraded to Confluence 4.3.2 last weekend and we've noticed that the quick search results section actually obscures the quick search text box.

This problem appears in both Firefox 17 and Chrome Stable. When I checked the calculated value of the top positioning for the search box results element, I saw that it was set to:
{{top: 26.639999389648438px;}}
This is pretty much the same position as the bottom of the Confluence NavBar, which makes sense, as you want the results to appear below the search text entry box. This is not a problem normally, but if you use a site-wide banner in Confluence as per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Add+a+Site-Wide+Banner], then you're pushing down the navbar while leave the search results box position unchanged. This obscures the search text entry box.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enter a site-wide banner as per [this doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Add+a+Site-Wide+Banner]
# Start typing in the quick search box to bring up suggested results
# Observe that the suggestions appear too high and obscure the search box
fields.summary: Confluence search box results are absolutely positioned, but should be relative to the position of the search box

fields.description:
Repeated many times in Firefox 16.0.2 on OSX 10.6.8

When a user changes the width of the sidebar pagetree either by clicking and dragging the sidebar, or toggling it with the button (div id="splitter-button") the sidebar resets itself when a new window, or tab are opened.

This behavior changes some by refreshing the page after updating the sidebar width, it then 'remembers' the setting for future pages.

When looking at the cookies, the first time the page is loaded, the 'doc-sidebar' cookie is 'undefined' until the page is loaded the second time. 

I read up a bit on how the jQuery Splitter add-on used for the splitter works (http://methvin.com/splitter/) and it mentions that the browser will cache the setting - I suspect this is why it remembers the setting after refreshing the page a second time. Therefore, it seems that Firefox and Confluence's javascript interact with the cookie is buggy.

This feature was reported by our users as reliable before we upgraded to Confluence 4.3.2 (from 3.5.9), but now users find that they can not keep the sidebar hidden as they could in the previous Confluence version.

This behavior works as expected with Google's Chrome (23.0).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View a page in a Documentation Themed space
# Drag the sidebar to the left to hide or shrink it
# Open a link in a new tab/page
#- Observe that the sidebar is back to original width
# Go back to the original page where the sidebar is shrunk and open a link, or refresh the page
#- Observe that the sidebar stays shrunk

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page after minimising the sidebar, to 'save' the setting
fields.summary: Documentation Theme Sidebar 'forgets' setting in Firefox

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Using Chrome browser, embedding code with object id tag into HTML macro will returns 'about:blank' page when Save is pressed. This however works when codes with iframe tag is embedded. 

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Enable Confluence HTML Macros modules with '*html*' title.
# Create a new page within any space, {{Insert >> Other Macros >> HTML}}.
# Paste code with object id tag.
# Save the page.

h4. Testing
Tested in Chrome, Firefox and Internet Explorer but only affects Chrome.

h4. Screenshot
!object_id.jpg|thumbnail!

h4. Code
{code}
<object id="flashObj" width="480" height="270" classid="clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=9,0,47,0"><param name="movie" value="http://c.brightcove.com/services/viewer/federated_f9?isVid=1&isUI=1" /><param name="bgcolor" value="#FFFFFF" /><param name="flashVars" value="videoId=1987039652001&playerID=870629586001&playerKey=AQ~~,AAAAybGkmck~,F3GR0Q5_RUi6gx4QbplYHsMIL-n4u_bH&domain=embed&dynamicStreaming=true" /><param name="base" value="http://admin.brightcove.com" /><param name="seamlesstabbing" value="false" /><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true" /><param name="swLiveConnect" value="true" /><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always" /><embed src="http://c.brightcove.com/services/viewer/federated_f9?isVid=1&isUI=1" bgcolor="#FFFFFF" flashVars="videoId=1987039652001&playerID=870629586001&playerKey=AQ~~,AAAAybGkmck~,F3GR0Q5_RUi6gx4QbplYHsMIL-n4u_bH&domain=embed&dynamicStreaming=true" base="http://admin.brightcove.com" name="flashObj" width="480" height="270" seamlesstabbing="false" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowFullScreen="true" allowScriptAccess="always" swLiveConnect="true" pluginspage="http://www.macromedia.com/shockwave/download/index.cgi?P1_Prod_Version=ShockwaveFlash"></embed></object>
{code}
{code}
<iframe width="420" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/eDFfPbQtTL0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
{code}
fields.summary: Embedded code with object id tag in HTML macro will return 'about:blank' page in Chrome

fields.description:
This issue is observed in machine with the following OS platform (regradless whether the keyboard uses English or German layout):
- Windows
- Linux

Not happening in MAC. Reason being that MAC keyboard has no Windows key.

This issue is also observed in these browsers:
- Chrome
- Firefox
- IE

By right, Windows key should not cause the sidebar to be shown/hidden because '[' is the keyboard shortcut for it.

Here is the screen cast of the issue: http://screencast.com/t/OIf0Oa7OGoQV

Although it is a minor bug but it could be quite annoying for some users.
fields.summary: The sidebar is shown & hidden when Windows key (in the keyboard) is entered

fields.description:
Customer reported that when using a keyboard shortcut '[' to show or hide sidebar (when Documentation Theme is activated), it has no effect in German Keyboard Layout.

Switching to English Keyboard Layout, the shortcut work as expected.

h5. Workaround:
Switch to English Keyboard Layout
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut '[' not working correctly with German Keyboard Layout
